edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator
Class Collision

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.wsu.KepheraSimulator.Collision
public class Collision
extends java.lang.Object

The Collision class provides methods to check for a collision between the robot and an object in the simulated environment. A collision can occur on the front of the robot or on the rear. This class provides a way to determine which type of collision occurred.

Field Summary
protected static int BACK_HIT
          Signifies a collision between the rear of the robot and some object.
protected static int FRONT_HIT
          Signifies a collision between the front of the robot and some object.
protected static int NO_HIT
          Signifies a status of no collision.
 
Constructor Summary
Collision(CurrentRobotState rs, int[][] wi, java.util.Vector stuck)
          Allocates a new Collision object that will detect collisions in the current simulator environment.
 
Method Summary
protected  int testCollision()
          Test for a collision between the current state of the robot and the simulator environment.

Constructor Detail

Collision

public Collision(CurrentRobotState rs,
                 int[][] wi,
                 java.util.Vector stuck)
Allocates a new Collision object that will detect collisions in the current simulator environment.

Parameters:
rs - a reference to the current state of the robot
wi - the simulator environment matrix
stuck - objects that exist in the simulator environment
Method Detail

testCollision

protected int testCollision()
Test for a collision between the current state of the robot and the simulator environment.

Returns:
an integer signifying a collision if one occurred and which type
